newsitem.title: IRAN: OPEC ministers renew call for quota compliance.
newsitem.headline: OPEC ministers renew call for quota compliance.

text.p: Seven OPEC ministers in Isfahan on Thursday renewed their call for members to abide by output quotas to prevent a further fall in crude prices.
"All of us feel we need to be careful about the market," said Iranian oil minister Gholamerza Aghazadeh. "Everybody agreed to follow his production quota."
Nigerian oil minister Dan Etete, also attending an oil conference in the central Iranian city, said: "We are not joking. Strict compliance is a flagship of OPEC."
At the conference hosted by Iran were oil ministers from Nigeria, Lybia, Qatar, Kuwait, Indonesia and Venezuela. The Saudi Arabian, United Arab Emirate, Iraqi and Algerian ministers didn't attend.

According to a Reuters survey of oil companies and analysts released on Thursday, OPEC wellhead production rose in April to 27.05 million barrels per day (bpd), up 200,000 bpd on a revised 26.85 million bpd the previous month and more than two million bpd above the official ceiling agreed last June of 25.03 million bpd.
Among the biggest over-producers are Venezuela, at 3.16 million bpd compared with a quota of 2.359 million bpd, and Nigeria, with output of 2.14 million bpd compared with a 1.865 million bpd quota.
